title: Submers
text:
Submers is an album by Canadian musician Scott Morgan under the alias of <a href="Loscil">Loscil</a>. It was released in 2002 by <a href="Kranky%20%28record%20label%29">Kranky</a>.
Production and style.
Large portions of the music on "Submbers" was from <a href="classical%20music">classical music</a> that had been sampled and distorted by Morgan. <a href="AllMusic">AllMusic</a> described the sound on "Submbers" as not being very different from than Morgan's previous album "Triple Point", noting that the "only significant difference is the emphasis on waves of rhythm over thumps and pulses."
Each track on "Submers" is named after a <a href="submarine">submarine</a>. These ranged from early submarines such as the <a href="Gymnote">Gymnote</a> to the <a href="Russian%20submarine%20Kursk%20%28K-141%29">Russian submarine Kursk (K-141)</a>.
Release.
"Submers" was released by <a href="Kranky%20%28record%20label%29">Kranky</a> via compact disc on November 4, 2002. The album was reissued on vinyl for the first time on November 23, 2018 by Kranky.
Reception.
<a href="AllMusic">AllMusic</a> gave the album four and a half stars out of five, stating that the album "tops Morgan's impressive debut and provides further proof that the field of ambient techno continues to have plenty to offer" <a href="Pitchfork%20Media">Pitchfork Media</a> gave the album an 8.0 rating out of a possible 10, noting that "the delicate touches are what really make it." "<a href="Exclaim%21">Exclaim!</a>" stated that the album praised the album for "spellbinding songs and creating a continuously absorbing record" and that "Submers resonates with remarkable elegance from its opening tones to its closing echoes"
Reviewing the reissue in 2018, Rob Nay of "<a href="Exclaim%21">Exclaim!</a>" noted that "These low end-heavy grooves sound perfectly aquatic on wax; kudos are in order for Kranky, who have polished up an already glistening gem for further appreciation."
Track listing.
All songs composed and produced by Scott Morgan.
Credits.
Credits adapted from the album's sleeve.
